body_content.explanation: Gram-negative bacteria belong to a group of bacteria that cause particular diseases. They have a thin cell wall and can be recognized because they become pink after being treated with a particular stain (= a chemical that changes the colour of something):
examples: Sampling showed high counts of both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
The conditions are exacerbated by infection with the gram-negative pathogen helicobacter pylori.
